title: Robust Confinement State Classification with Uncertainty Quantification through Ensembled Data-Driven Methods
author: Yoeri Poels (École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne), Cristina Venturini (École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne), Alessandro Pau (École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne), Olivier Sauter (École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne), Vlado Menkovski (Eindhoven University of Technology), ..., the TCV team
relevance_why: The methods for uncertainty quantification and model robustness can be applied to enhance classification tasks in audio generation and restoration problems, particularly where reliability is critical.
background: The paper focuses on automatically classifying plasma confinement states in tokamaks using machine learning, a challenging task due to state transitions and data uncertainties.
contribution: This paper introduces an ensemble method that combines different model architectures and feature sets to effectively classify confinement states while quantifying uncertainty, achieving improved performance and robustness against missing data.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods in confinement state classification primarily provided point estimates without uncertainty quantification or robustness to missing signals.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances classification by employing ensemble techniques across model types and feature sets, directly addressing issues of uncertainty and input reliability.

key_innovation: The method uniquely combines dynamic and static modeling approaches using ensembles, allowing it to maintain high prediction accuracy while handling incomplete or corrupted data.
real_world_impact: The advancements in classification reliability can be beneficial in real-time plasma monitoring in fusion research, potentially leading to enhanced fusion performance. No immediate real-world impact beyond the research field was specified.
limitations: The paper does not explicitly mention limitations.

new_terms.ensemble methods: **Ensemble methods** combine predictions from multiple models to improve classification accuracy and robustness compared to single models.
new_terms.Fourier Neural Operator: **Fourier Neural Operator** is a type of neural network architecture designed to model functions across time and space effectively, particularly beneficial for dynamic data.
